titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the W. H. Wilkinson Records 1919-1939
titlestmt.subtitle: Wilkinson, W. H. Records Mss. Acc. 2009.325

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created by Ute Schechter, Warren E. Burger Archivist, Lily Rubino, SCRC Staff, 2009

frontmatter.titlepage:
Inventory of the W. H. Wilkinson Records, 1919-1939 A Collection in the
Special Collections Research Center Mss. Acc. 2009.325
Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary 2012 &contact;
Processed By
Special Collections Staff.

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Records, 1919-1939, of San Francisco Lawyer W.H. Wilkinson concerning the legal status and travel regulations of Chinese immigrants living in the U.S., as well as immigration applications of Chinese citizens planning to move to the United States. Included is correspondence with state and federal agencies, employers, banks, and clients. Photographs are attached to the majority of the files.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Before reproducing or quoting from any materials, in whole or in part, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Research Center, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: W. H. Wilkinson Records, Special Collections Research Center, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were acquired by Special Collections Research Center on 07/27/2009.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessioned and minimally processed in July 2009 by Ute Schechter, Warren E. Burger Archivist. Rehoused and arranged alphabetically by Lily Rubino, SCRC Staff, in September 2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Information about this individual or organization may be available in the Special Collections Research Center Wiki: http://scrc.swem.wm.edu/wiki/index.php/W. H. Wilkinson

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Records, 1919-1939, of San Francisco Lawyer W.H. Wilkinson concerning the legal status and travel regulations of Chinese immigrants living in the U.S., as well as immigration applications of Chinese citizens planning to move to the United States. Included is correspondence with state and federal agencies, employers, banks, and clients. Photographs are attached to the majority of the files.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: For information on Chinese Immigration and the Chinese in the United States see the following National Archives link:http://www.archives.gov/locations/finding-aids/chinese-immigration.html.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.
